 18 /**
 19  * Baseclass for server side widgets.
 20  * 
 21  * <p> The velocity response writer is used, the widget only specifies the
 22  *     template name in the getTemplateName() method. </p>
 23  *
 24  * @param properties A map of fields to set. Refer to the list of non-private fields. 
 25  * @class AbstractServerSideWidget
 26  * @augments jQuery.solrjs.AbstractWidget
 27  */
 28 jQuery.solrjs.AbstractServerSideWidget = jQuery.solrjs.createClass ("AbstractWidget", /** @lends jQuery.solrjs.AbstractServerSideWidget.prototype */  { 
 29   
 30   /**
 31    * Adds the velocity specific request parameters to the url and creates a JSON call
 32    * using a dynamic script tag. The html response from the velocity template gets wrapped inside a 
 33    * javascript object to make cross site requests possible.
 34    * 
 35    * @param url The solr query request
 36    */
 37   executeHttpRequest : function(url) { 
 38     url += "&wt=velocity&v.response=QueryResponse&v.json=?&jsoncallback=?&v.contentType=text/json&v.template=" + this.getTemplateName();
 39     url += "&solrjs.widgetid=" + this.id;   
 40     var me = this;
 41     jQuery.getJSON(url,
 42       function(data){
 43         me.handleResult(data.result);
 44       }
 45     );
 46   },
 47   
 48   getTemplateName : function() { 
 49    throw("Abstract method");
 50   },
 51   
 52   /**
 53    * The default behaviour is that the result of teh template is simply "copied" to the target div.
 54    * 
 55    * @param result The result of the velocity template wrapped inside a javascript object.
 56    */
 57   handleResult : function(result) { 
 58     jQuery(this.target).html(result);
 59   },
 60 
 61 });
 62 
 63
